WRITING.TEXT:
[Tom Day - Lorn](https://soundcloud.com/tomday/tom-day-lorn), opened the Ambient door for me. Will never forget the first time I heard it while looking at the stars.
[Slowing Inertia - Farewell](https://soundcloud.com/slowingnertia/farewell), Post-rock. The unexpected climax hits ... .
[RUDE - Eternal Youth](https://rudemn.bandcamp.com/track/eternal-youth) Taught me that there is music that expresses certain Anime vibes. Got me to discover the youtube channel [AnimeVibe](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9uLMAmdGQaeLPHAOqkYlrw), a few words aren't enough for the channel too.
Misread the title for "songs" instead of song. Whoops, well here you go!
There are so many but at this moment I would want to be a Peregrine falcon, the fastest bird. To experience flight: high and dive, to see places in shorter time, experience a new adrenaline.

Yeah I had the same problem with an opponent, his snake model had to make a decision and just didn't wanna talk. The problem was that its talking wasn't clear to us, we searched for the snake alphabet and try sssshh ppsshhh ssh-en but even after the effort we couldn't understand. We sat it in front of a bright light, threatened to boil him but he wouldn't budge. In the end we obviously called Harry Potter which took some days but got us the answer
No I saw it dissappear from my hand as soon as I drew it and seeing it appear in his hand.

Sorry for the late answer! I was playing Warrior and on my turn I drew Sea Reaver (Epic Warrior class card), as soon as I saw the card it went into my opponent's hand and it's effect resolved there. (Dealing 1 damage to all of his minions)
I believe I was playing against a Priest.

WRITING.TITLE: My Epic card got into my opponent's hand when drawn, how?
WRITING.TEXT: My Epic card got into my opponent's hand as soon as I drew it. What card of my opponent triggered this? It wasn't shown in the card history.
